Gold Coast Titans NRL player Bryce Cartwright has been cleared to return to training despite not having a flu shot, after being granted a medical exemption. Key points:

articles.author: Matt Dennien
articles.title: Binna Burra Lodge to finally rise from ashes by end of July - Brisbane Times
articles.description: The heritage-listed lodge will begin partial retrading within months after bushfire tore through the Gold Coast hinterland in September.
articles.content:
Partial trading would likely begin "toward the end of July" after an official reopening of the road, with food and beverage services to be made available for those undertaking day trips.
The Binna Burra Kitchen, on the old school site at Beechmont, will open… [+1113 chars]

articles.title: 'We aren't friends': Nick Kyrgios' ugly split from tennis flame - Yahoo Sport Australia
articles.description: The Aussie tennis dynamo is no longer on speaking terms with Anna Kalinskaya.
articles.content:
Nick Kyrgios has endured an acrimonious end to his relationship with fellow tennis pro Anna Kalinskaya, after the Russian star confirmed the pair had split on Instagram.

articles.title: 'My teeth are falling out': UFC fighter cops battering - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: American Anthony Smith took a moment to hand the referee a tooth during his defeat to Brazilian veteran Glover Teixeira.
articles.content:
"My teeth are falling out," the American told his cornermen between the fourth and fifth rounds.
Smith even appeared to find one of his teeth during the latter stage of the fight and hand it to the referee, before the merciful stoppage.
